data.title: Feature request - TouchProcessor.as
[Request] Device font in TextField with anti-aliasing
data.body:
Some of East Asian characters(Kanji, Traditional Hanzi, Hangul, Thai alphabet, etc) have many stroke, "dotty-characters" of device font can make our eyes strained.
I suggest to add "useDeviceFontWithAntiAliasing" property to TextField Object and if the property is true, render the text texture with anti-aliased characters.

One of ideas of the implementation:
http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/antialiasing-with-device-fonts#post-78844

Thanks.

Hey Daniel,not only the AssetManager would call "uploadFromBitmapData",but also the TextField.createRenderedContents.

Error: Error #3768: The Stage3D API may not be used during background execution on this operating system.

Hi,

Best Regards!

data.title: Zip support in AssetManager
data.body:
AssetManager should probably support zip files.  Given a zip it can give access to the images/sounds/etc via the zip internal file names. 

This is discussed on the forum here: http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/assetmanager-addition

The only gotcha is that for textures it needs an onRestore that loads from the zip file.

data.title: Add PMA param to RenderTexture's constructor
data.body: Currently all RenderTextures use premultiplied alpha. I'd like to create a RenderTexture with standard alpha, but there's no way to set it using RenderTexture's constructor. Please add it as one of the params.

data.title: Adobe AIR17. Starling does't run on some devices. May be Agal v3?
data.body:
We have a game on Android Market, that uses Starling.
After AIR17 integration (without code changes) we have many complaints (~5% of users) from our players that game is not loading and stops at startscreen. Seems it hapens when Starling is initialized.
We return AIR16 and it fixes this problem.

With AIR16 we add new profiles ("standard", "standardConstrained") in Straling class.

private function requestContext3D(stage3D:Stage3D, renderMode:String, profile:Object):void
 {
            var profiles:Array;
            var currentProfile:String;

```
        if (profile == "auto")
            profiles = ["standard", "standardConstrained", "baselineExtended", "baseline", "baselineConstrained"];
```

....
}

I think that problem is in AGALMiniAssembler. We use standart Starling ColorMatrixFilter and BlurFilter, that uses AGALMiniAssembler.
But according to AIR17 changelog (https://helpx.adobe.com/flash-player/release-note/fp_17_air_17_release_notes.html) new AGALMiniAssembler need only for new "standardExtended" profile. 

Can we use AGALMiniAssembler version 3 (https://github.com/adobe-flash/graphicscorelib/blob/master/src/com/adobe/utils/v3/AGALMiniAssembler.as)? It has other package name com.adobe.utils.v3.

Or may be our problem is same as this issue https://github.com/Gamua/Starling-Framework/issues/676

List of devices (form google dev console):
Galaxy Tab4 7.0 (degas3g)
Galaxy Tab2 10.1 (espresso10rf)
Galaxy S Advance (GT-I9070)
Galaxy Tab3 Lite (goya3g)
ASUS Fonepad ME371MG (ME371MG)
Galaxy Tab3 7.0 (lt023g)
MediaPad 7 Lite (hws7930u)

data.title: Minor documentation request for explaining Starling showStats memory
data.body:
It might be useful to say a few words in the showStats documentation
http://doc.starling-framework.org/core/starling/core/Starling.html#showStats
about what the memory reported here actually is (not reporting GPU memory use) and maybe throwing a bone to tell people to profile with Adobe Scout for a complete breakdown of memory use.

I'd even go so far as to suggest even removing the memory stat from the showStats. Too many people ask about what the memory is reporting without bothering to check the source code of Starling to confirm.

Best Regards!

data.title: BGR_565 texture contours with a scaled stage
data.body:
hello Daniel,

i have a question about sub textures and scaling. let's say, i have a texture atlas with some small (62x62px) "565" packed textures on a pink background padded by 1 pixel.

in the Starling root Sprite, Image classes are used to arrange the sub-textures.
the Starling stage is constant while the viewport just scales to make a fit on the Native stage (e.g. via RectangleUtil.fit(), not pixel perfect).

EDIT: i should probably add that in my test the Starling stage is bigger than the viewport.

what i'm observing when dragging the edge of the projector window to reduce it, is pink contours appearing at the edges of the Image elements. what i assume is that this is probably unavoidable due to sub-pixel scaling. could i attempt to somehow round the size of viewPort to prevent that?

the strange part is that if i use the pixel perfect scale in RectangleUtil.fit() on the stage and animate said Image elements the pink contours start appearing again.

if you want, i can possibly (hopefully) reproduce that in a demo project and post it here?

AIR 16.0.0.292, a very recent Starling from git.

data.title: Losing Stage3D Context results in runtime exception
data.body:
The exception does not occur every time when losing stage3d context, just when some conditions are met (which I was not able to figure out yet..). But both Debug and Release SWF failed with this:

```
TypeError: Error #1006: value is not a function.
at starling.textures::ConcreteTexture/onContextCreated()[\starling\textures\ConcreteTexture.as:220]
at starling.events::EventDispatcher/invokeEvent()[\starling\events\EventDispatcher.as:145]
at starling.events::EventDispatcher/dispatchEvent()[\starling\events\EventDispatcher.as:117]
at starling.events::EventDispatcher/dispatchEventWith()[\starling\events\EventDispatcher.as:195]
at starling.core::Starling/initializeGraphicsAPI()[\starling\core\Starling.as:446]
at starling.core::Starling/initialize()[\starling\core\Starling.as:429]
at starling.core::Starling/onContextCreated()[\starling\core\Starling.as:678]
```

I think mRestore() is called without null check.

data.title: Define Starling root after constructor
data.body:
It would be helpful if we could fully initialize Starling before providing it with the root display object. Sometimes, I want to do something between Starling initializing and the root display object being created. Especially if I need multiple NativeWindows in AIR desktop.

There is precedence to creating a stage without a root in the native display list. In AIR, when you create a NativeWindow, it has a stage, but no root. If I were to wrap NativeWindow in a Feathers component, it would make sense to offer the same experience.

In my plans to support MXML in Feathers, I'd like to have a main application class that abstracts Starling initialization. It would be ideal if I could set up a Feathers theme before the root is created so that the root can be a Feathers component. It's technically possible now, but it requires manual work for developers that I would  rather abstract away.

In my implementation, I made the following changes:

1) The rootClass parameter in the constructor may be set to null. initializeRoot() checks for this new possibility.

2) I added a root setter that can accept a display object. If a root already exists, it will be removed and disposed. If Starling hasn't fully initialized, the new root will be saved until initializeRoot() is called. In initializeRoot(), the saved root will it be added to the stage, and Event.ROOT_CREATED will be dispatched. If the root setter is used after initializeRoot() has been called, the new root is immediately added to the stage without an event.

The normal case of passing a valid rootClass to the constructor should behave exactly the same.

data.title: BitmapFont too lenient (silent fail) when not using BMFont XML format?
data.body:
With this forum thread as a sample:
http://forum.starling-framework.org/topic/i-cant-show-bitmap-fonts-without-color-tint-help-me-please

Is it possible the current BitmapFont setup/parsing code is too lenient with its XML processing so that it silently fails to create a working BitmapFont when passed (for example) the text BMFont format?

Maybe BitmapFont should raise a warning when it isn't able to find at least a face attribute or any characters in the XML parsing phase to make it easier for a first time setup to debug the mistake?

data.title: fixed: AssetManager fails loading when enqueued flash.filesystem.File contains Unicode non-ascii path string.
data.body:
AssetManager fails loading when enqueued flash.filesystem.File contains Unicode non-ascii path string.
This patch fixes it.
Additionally, I added AIR version of test suite to certify it.

data.title: avoiding Texture size overflow when creating TextField with long long texts by lowering its resolution.
data.body:
This is a feature that avoid texture size exceeds the system limit when you create TextFields contains very large font or long string.
If bitmap data from the native flash TextField has over 2048 pixels width or height, It 'll be re-rendered lowering the resolution to fit in 2048x2048.

data.title: BitmapFont Bidirectional TextField integration
data.body:
hi Daniel,

please have a look at the following repository:
https://github.com/HendrixString/Starling-Bidi-TextField
- this is a Bidirectional (RTL and LTR) BitmapFont TextField implementation
  as outlined at http://unicode.org/reports/tr9/
- i wrote it a year ago or more as a text engine for a commercial application that had
  50K downloads. I made some order in my sources and decided to interest you in
  integrating this into Starling, (i do request regardless that BitmapFont and TextField have their
  properties protected to make the components more of an extension ).

please tell me what you think.
the company I work for decided to go Native for most of our projects and we
ended up with tons of open source contribution being uploaded to my GitHub account.

data.title: Some problem about setRenderTarget
Fixed possible memory leak when using async ATF texture upload.
data.body: Unlike Starling objects native Flash textures do not remove their event listeners when texture is being disposed. Calling 'ConcreteTexture::dispose' right after 'ConcreteTexture::uploadAtfData' leaves Starling- and Flash- texture objects referencing each other which is increasing cost of garbage collection as these two objects can not be GC'ed during reference counting phase. This can even lead to a memory leak. Second possible problem related to this issue is async callback triggering on a disposed texture which can introduce unexpected behavior in application.

data.title: Uncaught ArgumentError: Error #3672 at starling.display::QuadBatch/createBuffers()
data.body:
Hi,

This error is a nightmare. Has been triggering randomly for ages, now in latest Android release (built with AIR 17), thousands of users are getting it on first launch... without any major change the in app code (and no issues on testing devices: Galaxy S4, Galaxy S3 mini...).

Uncaught ArgumentError: Error #3672
    at starling.display::QuadBatch/createBuffers()
    at starling.display::QuadBatch/syncBuffers()
    at starling.display::QuadBatch/renderCustom()
    at starling.core::RenderSupport/finishQuadBatch()
    at starling.core::RenderSupport/batchQuad()
    at starling.display::Image/render()
    at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()
    at starling.display::Sprite/render()
    at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()
    at starling.display::Sprite/render()
    at starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()
    at starling.core::Starling/render()
    at starling.core::Starling/nextFrame()
    at starling.core::Starling/onEnterFrame()

Impossible to debug and causes the app to crash.

I don't know if this is a Starling bug or an AIR / Flash bug but Starling is supposedly backed by Adobe. Is there no way of getting them to actually fix theses bugs?

Another one I reported that has been closed by adobe that still occurs thousands of times per day on our userbase (finally overrid starling & try catched the rendering..) : https://github.com/Gamua/Starling-Framework/issues/630
